title.narrative: IMPROVED GENDER- EQUITABLE OPPORTUNITIES IN EDUCATION.

description.narrative: Girls and boys, including vulnerable children, have improved gender- equitable opportunities in education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized and those affected by humanitarian crises, are provided with inclusive and equitable qualityeducation and learning opportunities.

sector.narrative: Digital learning materials and ICT in education
Ending violence against women and girls
Provision or procurement of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) learning materials
Provision or procurement of secondary education learning materials
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls and boys, including vulnerable children, have improved gender- equitable opportunities in education.

description.narrative: Addressing gender-related learning bottlenecks, UNICEF is piloting a remedial education programme at school-level to improve learning while also utilizing various communication means to address social norms that negatively impede girls’ education. This reached more than 13,906 children, 74 per cent of them girls, in 2021.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
